author: ArtistAngie
title: #RIPUncleBosey: Biden's 'Uncle Bosey' Being Eaten by Cannibals Lie Inspires Hilarious Hashtag ‚Äì Twitchy
text: Twitter changed its name to X and some things seem to get better but there is nothing in this world that will ever beat old-school Twitter Hashtag games and we found one that was that kind of old-school funny. We legitimately laughed out loud, full belly laughs and a snort. We hope you do as well. To read about the story that inspired the tag you can click [here](https://twitchy.com/brettt/2024/04/17/biden-tells-steelworkers-his-cannibals-story-again-n2395211). Let's Go! [#RIPUncleBosey](https://twitter.com/search?q=%23RIPUncleBosey&src=typed_query) We think this hashtag started with a simple comment to someone talking about the insane story. [April 17, 2024] It went on from there and it is GLORIOUS! This is why they have to script everything he does. When they set him free, he goes off telling old man stories.‚Äî Don'tBeAJagoff (@Eponine1973) [#RIPUncleBosey] [April 17, 2024] She's not wrong. Being a known plagiarist and liar, he tends to 'embellish' things, and the legacy media likes to ignore that. Joe's uncle died feeding the hungry.‚Äî  û…πƒ±…Øùïä (@FoundersGirl) [#RIPUncleBosey] [April 18, 2024] Like any good Leftist, Uncle Bosey was a giver! Previously unknown picture of Uncle Bosey released.‚Äî TheMorningSpew2 (@TheMorningSpew2) [#RIPUncleBosey] [pic.twitter.com/ZY2somQeBy] [April 18, 2024] Bwahahaha! He seemed to be so happy before the big meal. Sorry Uncle Bosey, need to tenderize you a little first.‚Äî #Nats Fan Carla (@LibertyBelleCJL) [#RIPUncleBosey] [pic.twitter.com/HMINzFMeba] [April 18, 2024] STOP IT! Stop it right now. We should not be laughing this much. In our defense, Uncle Bosey did not get eaten by cannibals. He did die, which is sad, but he was not eaten by cannibals. Popular Irish dishes in Papua New Guinea include:‚Äî Fuzzy Chimp üá∫üá∏ (@fuzzychimpcom) - Bosey and Mash - Shepherd‚Äôs Thigh - Corned Bosey - Bread Pudding Brain - Bosxty [#RIPUncleBosey] [April 18, 2024] Recommended Ok, but we do not see Bosey BBQ Beef Jerkey on that list, and beef jerky is a camping staple.:) ‚Äî Jodi (@APLMom) [#RIPUncleBosey] [https://t.co/wSJr7GF4i9] [pic.twitter.com/uAAd4bU4Hr] [April 18, 2024] Oh good grief, even if you were a Biden supporter you have to admit that hashtag is hilarious! Found a picture of the cannibal who ate Uncle Bosey.‚Äî Artist_Angie: Sensei of Sarcasm (@Artist_Angie) IYKYK [#TheWalkingDead] [#RIPUncleBosey] [pic.twitter.com/3Ulgf4hShx] [April 18, 2024] [April 18, 2024] I heard he was served with fava beans and a nice Chianti.‚Äî Mark The Shark (@MRaff57) [#RIPUncleBosey] [pic.twitter.com/2z8O2WkQe1] [April 18, 2024] Are there any Walking Dead fans out there? We are sorry for including our own tweet, but it made us laugh and had some good replies. But did the natives have a nice Chianti?‚Äî Grateful Calvin (@shoveitjack) [#RIPUncleBosey] [https://t.co/I7tBtAn21y] [pic.twitter.com/lFK6EJVlFH] [April 18, 2024] Our bet is yes. haha ‚Äî David in Dallas, Texas üôèüáÆüá± (@David_in_Dallas) [#RIPUncleBosey] "I Eat Cannibals" by Toto Coelo (1983) [pic.twitter.com/aKw5dKyckD] [April 18, 2024] Oooh always nice to add music to a good meal. Good thing Uncle Bosey was a pilot and not a clown - or else he would have tasted funny.‚Äî (((ùñëùñéùñòùñòùñÜ))) (@lissa77) [#RIPUncleBosey] [April 18, 2024] ‚Äî Lizzy Lou Who üå∑ (@_wintergirl93) [#RIPUncleBosey] [pic.twitter.com/5Al17Lv6fy] [April 18, 2024] *SNORT* There are reports that Uncle Bosey choked on a piece of Corn Pop.‚Äî TheMorningSpew2 (@TheMorningSpew2) [#RIPUncleBosey] [April 18, 2024] We love that another Joe Biden lie was incorporated. PERFECTION! In keeping with Joe Biden's example of leadership and how to be a good person, we lied in that cover image. WE ARE LAUGHING and we hope you are too! Related: [Climate Cultists Shut Down Gala Honoring Senator Lisa Murkowski and It Does NOT Look Peaceful](https://twitchy.com/artistangie/2024/04/18/climate-cult-shuts-down-gala-honoring-senator-lisa-murkowski-n2395255) [Hamas Lied, the Media Cried, and the Silence Cannot Be Denied](https://twitchy.com/artistangie/2024/04/14/hamas-admits-inflated-death-count-in-gaza-n2395071) [CDC Clears Themselves Reporting COVID Vaccine NOT Responsible for Fatal Heart Problems in Teens](https://twitchy.com/artistangie/2024/04/11/nbc-cdc-report-finds-covid-vaccine-not-responsible-for-deadly-fatal-heart-issues-n2394997) ['Another Day, Another W': DeSantis Signs New Laws Targeting Child Sex Abuse](https://twitchy.com/artistangie/2024/04/10/desantis-targets-child-sexual-abuse-n2394942) ['Who Knew Poverty Tasted So Good?' Spam and Other Cheap Meat Benefit From Bidenomics](https://twitchy.com/artistangie/2024/04/09/spam-and-other-cheap-meat-benefit-from-bidenomics-n2394924)

author: Zach Dooley For LAKingsInsider.com
title: FINAL - Kings 0, Lightning 3 - Kopitar, Spence, Hiller - LA Kings Insider
text:
The Kings droppped their fourth consecutive game on the road, falling by a 3-0 final score on Thursday evening against the Tampa Bay Lightning.
Just shy of five minutes into the game, the Lightning opened the scoring. Forward Brandon Hagel, skating in transition, pulled a move on Kings defenseman Jordan Spence in a 1-on-1 situation before skating in on a breakaway. Hagel shot five hole on Kings netminder David Rittich, scoring his 21st goal of the season to give the hosts an early 1-0 advantage.
For the third time in four games, the Kings had a goal taken off the board, one that would have tied the game midway through the second period. Out of the penalty box, defenseman Jacob Moverare appeared to gain the offensive zone and find a charging Quinton Byfield, with the latter scoring his 12th goal of the season, but Moverare was judged to be offsides on a Tampa Bay coaches challenge, keeping the score 1-0 Lightning.
With fewer than five minutes to play in the third period, Tampa Bay doubled its advantage, as Hagel buried his second goal of the game. With forward Nikita Kucherov on a breakaway, Rittich aggressively charged out and made a sprawling save on the first attempt, but Hagel followed up on the play and put home the rebound from close range, giving the hosts a two-goal lead.
With the Kings on a late, 6-on-4 power play, Tampa Bay forward Anthony Cirelli hit the empty net from distance, bringing the game to the 3-0 final score.
Hear from Anze Kopitar, Jordan Spence and Jim Hiller following tonight‚Äôs game.
Anze Kopitar
On the team‚Äôs struggles offensively right now
It seems like we‚Äôre doing the right things, it‚Äôs just you‚Äôve got to keep on going really. I mean, we do have chances but for whatever reason, the puck‚Äôs are not going in. It‚Äôs very hard mentally now, when you‚Äôre not scoring and losing tight games. It ends up being 3-0 tonight but it was tighter than the score. We‚Äôve got to find a way, that‚Äôs the bottom line, I mean, there‚Äôs no other way to put it, really. We‚Äôre going to have to score goals, whether that‚Äôs on on the power play, 5-on-5, we‚Äôve just got to find a way.
On the team‚Äôs frustration level, with the work and compete being there, without the offense
Yeah, it‚Äôs pretty frustrating. The goalies are doing a really good job of keeping us in the game and everything. We‚Äôre not giving up a whole lot, it‚Äôs just like I said, putting the puck in the net. It falls on this group and me being on the top of that list to get the offense going.
On where he feels the team‚Äôs confidence level is right now
I wouldn‚Äôt say the confidence is sky high right now, but sometimes all it takes, it‚Äôs a little bounce, a little something to spark the group. We‚Äôre still obviously confident that it‚Äôs within this room.
On if three disallowed goals over four games feels like ‚Äúwhen it rains, it pours‚Äù
Yeah, it sure does, but can‚Äôt look back. We‚Äôve just got to refocus and make sure that on Saturday, we‚Äôre ready to go again and keep on grinding away.
Jordan Spence
On the offensive struggles of the group right now
I don‚Äôt think our confidence is there right now. Obviously we have some chances to score some goals and we‚Äôre not capitalizing on our chances. At the end of the day, we‚Äôre just not playing well right now. We‚Äôve got to just reset, forget about tonight and be ready for Carolina.
On the frustration level right now when the puck isn‚Äôt going in for the team
It‚Äôs been tough. We‚Äôre not doing our job to score goals. At the end of the day, we have to score goals to win games and we‚Äôre not doing that. At the end of the game, I think we‚Äôre showing our emotions on why we‚Äôre mad and I think, overall, it wasn‚Äôt our game. We just have to stop it.
On the momentum downswing that disallowed goals give the team
At the end of the day, it‚Äôs hockey, it happens, teams go through slumps, but I think good teams, they get back up and try to do the best to win games and that‚Äôs what we‚Äôve got to try and do. We‚Äôre getting some bad bounces right now, but think if we if we play our game, if we do the right things on the ice, good things will always come. We‚Äôre just going to try and get our confidence and our mojo back.
On having Drew Doughty back with the group again
He‚Äôs a key part of our team, on and off the ice. We‚Äôre really happy to have him back and every shift that he goes out there, he gets better and better. Big to see that. It‚Äôs unfortunate that we‚Äôve lost two games in a row but at the end of the day, it‚Äôs good to get that leader that‚Äôs vocal, on and off the ice, to get us going, get our get our groove back and try to win games.
Jim Hiller
*Hiller confirmed before the game that defenseman Brandt Clarke would be a healthy scratch in tonight‚Äôs game. He added that he has had a conversation with Clarke about the situation, but did not elaborate on Clarke‚Äôs status beyond that.
Notes ‚Äì
‚Ä¢ Goaltender David Rittich turned aside 30 of the 32 shots on goal he faced in tonight‚Äôs game. This marks Rittich‚Äôs first 30-save performance since he made 31 stops on March 30, 2024 at Calgary.
‚Ä¢ The netminder‚Äôs new single-game high in saves comes the day after his partner, Darcy Kuemper, made 36 saves on 38 shots faced against the Florida Panthers, his highest single-game total this season.
‚Ä¢ The Kings were shutout this evening for the fourth time this season and the second time in two nights. In total, the Kings have just four goals on their current trip to date and have scored an NHL-low 22 goals in 13 games during the month of January.
The Kings have a scheduled team off day tomorrow in Raleigh, after the back-to-back. The team will return to the ice on Saturday, February 1 for a full-team morning skate in North Carolina.

- Comments that incite political, religious or similar debates will be deleted.

author: @kbtxnews
title: 113 car seats inspected, 93 new car seats gifted to local families at safety event
text: 113 car seats inspected, 93 new car seats gifted to local families at safety event ‚ÄúProper use of child safety seats not only reduces medical costs but also prevents lost future earnings and improves a child‚Äôs quality of life following a collision.‚Äù BRYAN, Texas (KBTX) - There is new information about [Saturday‚Äôs car seat safety event in Bryan](https://www.kbtx.com/2024/09/15/daniel-stark-holds-car-seat-safety-event/). Daniel Stark Injury Lawyers hosted their 17th Annual Car Seat Safety Event to provide essential car seat inspections and distribute new child car seats at no cost to families who needed them. During the event, 113 car seat inspections were conducted but only one child was found to be a property-restrained seat. The statistic highlights the critical need for increased car seat safety awareness, said organizers. In total, Daniel Stark provided 93 new car seats to local families. Over 30 students from Bryan Collegiate High School volunteered to join Daniel Stark and Texas A&M AgriLife Extension during the event. ‚ÄúProper use of child safety seats not only reduces medical costs but also prevents lost future earnings and improves a child‚Äôs quality of life following a collision,‚Äù said Daniel Stark Public Communications Director Linda McMillan.‚Äù According to Texas A&M AgriLife, the Bryan event had an estimated economic impact of $234,889. Copyright 2024 KBTX. All rights reserved.

author: GB Times
title: How to get rid of meta ai search on Facebook?
text:
How to Get Rid of Meta AI Search on Facebook?
If you‚Äôre tired of Facebook‚Äôs Meta AI-powered search bar taking over your news feed, this article is for you. We‚Äôll explore the reasons behind this new search feature and provide step-by-step guides on how to disable it.
What is Meta AI Search?
Meta AI search is a feature that uses artificial intelligence to analyze your search queries, identify patterns, and provide personalized search results. It‚Äôs designed to make your Facebook experience more relevant and efficient, but many users have raised concerns about the loss of control over their data.
How to Disable Meta AI Search on Facebook?
Disabling Meta AI search on Facebook involves making a few tweaks to your settings. Follow these steps:
Table of Contents
Toggle
Step 1: Check if You Have the New Facebook Layout Step 2: Clear Cookies and Site Data Step 3: Disable the Search Bar Step 4: Opt-out of Custom Audiences Step 1: Check if You Have the New Facebook Layout
Open Facebook on your desktop or mobile device
Check if your Facebook layout resembles the following: A gray toolbar at the top with your name, profile picture, and a magnifying glass icon
A blue sidebar on the left with the Meta AI search bar
If you have this layout, proceed to Step 2. If not, you don‚Äôt have the new search feature enabled, and you can skip to the conclusion section.
Step 2: Clear Cookies and Site Data
Log out of Facebook
Go to your browser‚Äôs settings and search for "cookies"
Clear cookies, site data, and browsing history (ensure you have saved important logins or data first)
This step is crucial as Meta AI search stores user data on your browser to personalize search results. Clearing cookies will delete this data and disable the feature temporarily.
Step 3: Disable the Search Bar
Log back into Facebook
Click on the three horizontal lines or the gear icon at the top-right corner (depending on your browser)
Click on "Settings" and then "General Account Settings"
Scroll down to "Apps, Websites, and Devices"
Click on "Edit" next to "Apps, Websites, and Devices" and toggle off "Allow [Name] to read your search history" and "Allow [Name] to manage your search results"
This will remove the Meta AI search bar and prevent the app from tracking your search queries.
Step 4: Opt-out of Custom Audiences
Log in to your Facebook Ads Manager account
Click on "Assets" and then "Data Sources"
Find your ad account and click on "Edit" next to "Data Sources"
Click on "Add Data Source" and then "Other Data Source"
Fill out the required information, including your company name, industry, and data types you want to upload
Opt-out of custom audiences, allowing Meta to use your search data for targeting purposes
This step ensures that your search data isn‚Äôt used for targeted advertising.
How to Revert to Classic Search on Facebook?
Reverting to classic search on Facebook requires changing your search preference. Here‚Äôs how:
Open Facebook and go to the search bar
Type a query in the search bar
Click on the gear icon at the top-right corner
Click on "Settings"
Select "Search Settings"
Change "Default Search Engine" to "Basic"
This will restore the classic search engine and disable the Meta AI-powered search.
Common Issues and Troubleshooting Tips
Search bar won‚Äôt disappear: Try clearing browser cache, cookies, and site data (Steps 1-2). If the issue persists, contact Facebook support.
Can‚Äôt find the settings option: Ensure you have the correct Facebook layout and search for "Settings" at the top-right corner or in your profile dropdown menu.
Issues with custom audiences: Try revisiting your Ads Manager account and reviewing your data sources. If issues persist, contact Facebook support.
Conclusion
By following these steps, you should be able to disable Meta AI search on Facebook. Remember to clear cookies, disable the search bar, and opt-out of custom audiences to regain control over your data. Reverting to classic search will help you bypass the AI-powered search feature.
Keep in mind that Meta AI search is designed to provide a personalized experience, so you may encounter some limitations by disabling it. However, by taking control of your data and settings, you can customize your Facebook experience to your preferences.
Summary Table:
Step
Description
1
Check for new Facebook layout
2
Clear cookies and site data
3
Disable the search bar
4
Opt-out of custom audiences
5
Revert to classic search (optional)
Remember to review the issues and troubleshooting tips section if you encounter any difficulties during the process.
